page.title: 06Fullwood and Bland.ELLESMERE
page.content: In 1785 two brothers called Fullwood set up a firm which was to become Britains best known milking machine manufacturer.Today they still stand in that position in the U.K.and in Europe Fullwoods give more help to the dairy industry than any other business and have medals to prove it.Fullwood and Bland employ 218 people,but in the 1970's employed twice as many people. But with a small workforce,they make all the parts for the machines.They have workshops for metal and plasic parts and there is a demand for their products.Fullwoods also make milking machines for sheep and goats.Interest in goat farming has increased in the last couple of years and Fullwoods is making it increase even more.Sheeps milk is also in demand and Fullwoods make a range of milking machines for goats and sheep.
